intro: Banisteria gardneriana var. nummifera, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking clusters of yellow, pendulous flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is deciduous, shedding its leaves during the dry season, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Its ornamental value is due to its showy flowers and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often cultivated as a shade tree or for its decorative appeal in gardens.
